name: Kevin Biergans
tagline: Master’s student at the University of Notre Dame
about: I’m a master’s student at Notre Dame with a builder’s mindset—combining science, data, and business to solve real problems. I enjoy product strategy, user research, and turning messy ideas into simple, useful tools.
aboutParagraphs: Graduate student at the University of Notre Dame with a strong foundation in physiology and business, holding a B.S. from Michigan State University. Entrepreneurial self-starter and founder of a patient advocacy business, demonstrating initiative, empathy, and a passion for helping others navigate healthcare systems. Highly personable and communicative, with a natural ability to connect with diverse individuals and build trust. Eager to leverage interpersonal strengths and academic background to pursue a dynamic role in healthcare sales, business development, or client engagement within the healthcare industry.

bullets: Focus: product discovery, market validation, and go‑to‑market
Projects in healthtech and AI‑enabled productivity
Research experience, leadership in student orgs
Interviewed stakeholders and mapped workflows for a family health‑info assistant
Prototyped features, ran usability tests, and defined success metrics
Streamlined intake to reduce time‑to‑case‑start by 30%
Built tracking dashboards; standardized client updates

projects.title: Health Intake Flow Redesign
projects.blurb: Reduced form friction with progressive disclosure; +22% completion in pilot

projects.title: Admissions Outreach Sequencer
projects.blurb: Created a lightweight sequence for recruiting conversations; improved reply rate

projects.title: Data Notebook: Service Ops
projects.blurb: Exploratory analysis of job cycle times and bottlenecks

highlights: Comfortable in Figma, Python, SQL, Sheets
contactNote: Prefer a quick intro call? Send a couple times that work for you, and I’ll share a calendar link.
